dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Nasdaq 100’s Historic Bull Run Has Further to Go, Evercore Says
News Content: (Bloomberg) -- The Nasdaq 100 Index has nearly doubled since the start of 2023, adding $14 trillion in value in the process. Evercore ISI’s Rich Ross is prepared for that rally to continue, shrugging off fears of a familiar nemesis: rising bond yields.

Most Read from Bloomberg

Texas HOA Charged With Discrimination for Banning Section 8 Renters How Sanctuary Cities Are Preparing for Another Showdown With Trump Donations to LA Fire Victims Rise Past $200 Million Mark NY’s Hochul Calls for Law Banning Cell Phone Use in Schools LA Schools Wrecked by Fires Plead on GoFundMe for Help to Reopen

Treasury rates jumped to multi-month highs last week as investors parsed economic data for clues on the Federal Reserve’s next interest-rate cut following US President Donald Trump’s election victory. The win ignited bets that his economic plans — like large import tariffs and mass deportations of low-wage undocumented workers — would stoke inflation and hurt growth, reducing the Fed’s scope to lower borrowing costs. That’s dented the appeal of rate-sensitive sectors, especially those with elevated valuations like technology.

The yield on the US 10-year has since pulled back after hitting a relative strength reading that usually signals a retreat. Pair that with positive technical signals and the Nasdaq 100 and S&P 500 Index both appear poised to hit fresh all-time highs in the first quarter, according to Ross, Evercore ISI’s head of technical analysis.

“At the end of the day technology remains in an outstanding position to continue to lead this market higher,” Ross said.

Through Tuesday, the tech-heavy equities benchmark has gone 467 sessions trading above its 200-day moving average — the second-longest such streak since the index’s inception four decades ago, according to data compiled by Bloomber.

The gauge currently trades around 10% above that long-term support level, a signal of relative stability to technical analysts who monitor daily averages and other metrics to determine stock-market momentum. This comes after the benchmark rose as much as 20% above that line in July — a level that preceded a summer rout and has historically foretold past selloffs.

The weeks ahead will be a pivotal stretch for stocks as Big Tech companies gear up to report quarterly earnings and the Fed’s next policy decision looms on Jan. 29. With earnings season already underway, investors are listening for how corporate chiefs expect the coming months to look. Next week is the busiest of the season, with reports coming from the likes of Apple Inc., Microsoft Corp. and Meta Platforms Inc.

Story Continues

To gauge where the 100-member index goes from here, John Kolovos, head of technical strategy at Macro Risk Advisors, is monitoring the largest exchange-traded fund tracking the Nasdaq 100 (QQQ). He sees technical supports between $485 and $495, around the ETF’s November lows. In his view, any pullbacks that are still above those thresholds provide a dip-buying opportunity.

“Falling yields are good for market breadth and equity-market participation,” said Kolovos. Technical analysts are also watching for whether Apple will catch a bid as the iPhone maker nears its 200-DMA.

After the yield on the 10-year Treasury briefly topped 4.8% last week — above its 2024 high — its fallen more than 20 basis points since then to hover around 4.57% on Tuesday. For Kolovos, the next key support level on the benchmark note’s rate is 4.5%, near its 50-DMA and a November peak. He’s also watching 4.8% and the late 2023 highs at 5% for resistance. The 10-year yield’s 14-day relative strength reading topped the 70 level two weeks ago, which some technicians view as a sign of overheating.

With the Nasdaq 100 roughly 2.4% below its December record, semiconductor stocks — a high-conviction idea from Evercore ISI’s Ross — are making fresh highs relative to software shares, suggesting that traders are rotating back into the chipmakers like Nvidia Corp. that have powered the bull market’s advance for more than two years.

In fact, the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), which holds chip bellwethers like Nvidia, Applied Materials Inc. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc., has outperformed the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) in five of the past six weeks, data compiled by Bloomberg show.

“Higher rates weigh uniquely on smaller caps and cyclicals such that when we get relief from rates, the first response is to buy back those hard hit groups,” Ross said. “When the dust settles, we go right back to those strong secular trends, big cash piles and big moats offered by Big Tech.”

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The news indicates a strong bullish sentiment for the Nasdaq 100, with analysts predicting further gains despite concerns over rising bond yields. The positive technical indicators and the expectation of strong earnings from major tech companies, including Apple, suggest a favorable environment for AAPL. Additionally, the recent pullback in Treasury yields could enhance the attractiveness of tech stocks. Given these factors, the probability of AAPL's stock price rising is higher than that of it falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article presents a generally positive outlook for the Nasdaq 100, driven by strong performance of technology stocks, including Apple. Evercore ISI's Rich Ross anticipates the rally to continue, supported by positive technical signals. While rising bond yields initially posed a threat, they have since retreated. The article highlights Apple's upcoming earnings report as a key event. John Kolovos's technical analysis suggests dip-buying opportunities. The article also mentions that Apple is nearing its 200-DMA, which could trigger a buy signal. Overall, the article leans towards a bullish outlook for tech stocks, including Apple, although earnings reports and Fed policy decisions could introduce volatility. Given the positive technical analysis and the expectation of continued tech leadership, the probability of a rise is slightly favored, but the upcoming earnings report introduces uncertainty.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the overall positive outlook for the Nasdaq 100 and the technology sector, citing positive technical indicators and the expectation of continued strong performance from Big Tech companies.  While rising bond yields were initially a concern, they have since retreated, easing pressure on tech stocks.  The article specifically highlights Apple's upcoming earnings report and mentions that technical analysts are watching for Apple to catch a bid as it nears its 200-day moving average.  The positive sentiment towards the broader tech market, coupled with the specific mention of Apple and its upcoming earnings, suggests a higher probability of a stock price rise for Apple. However, the inherent uncertainty of the market and the possibility of negative surprises in earnings reports must be considered. Therefore, while the probability of a price rise is higher, a fall is still possible.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article highlights a bullish outlook for the Nasdaq 100, driven by positive technical signals and a potential continuation of the tech-led rally. Evercore ISI's Rich Ross and other analysts suggest that despite rising bond yields, the tech sector, including Apple, is well-positioned to lead the market higher. Key points supporting this view include the Nasdaq 100's strong performance above its 200-day moving average, the pullback in Treasury yields, and the rotation back into semiconductor stocks, which often benefits Apple. Additionally, the upcoming earnings season and Fed policy decision are pivotal, but the overall sentiment leans towards optimism for Big Tech. Given Apple's prominence in the Nasdaq 100 and its upcoming earnings report, the positive market sentiment and technical indicators suggest a higher probability of a stock price rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article suggests a positive outlook for the technology sector, particularly for large-cap companies like Apple Inc. (AAPL). The Nasdaq 100 Index has shown significant resilience and is expected to continue its bull run, with technical analysts pointing to positive signals such as the index trading above its 200-day moving average and relative stability in the market. Additionally, the anticipation of Apple's quarterly earnings report and the overall positive sentiment towards Big Tech companies could contribute to a rise in their stock price. However, the article also mentions potential risks such as rising bond yields, which could impact the stock price negatively.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article suggests that the Nasdaq 100 Index, which includes Apple Inc., is expected to continue its bull run despite concerns over rising bond yields. The article cites technical analysis from Evercore ISI's Rich Ross, who believes that the index is poised to hit fresh all-time highs in the first quarter. Additionally, the article notes that the yield on the 10-year Treasury has pulled back after hitting a relative strength reading that usually signals a retreat, which could be a positive sign for the stock market. The article also mentions that Apple Inc. is nearing its 200-day moving average, which could provide a buying opportunity. Overall, the article presents a positive outlook for the tech sector and the Nasdaq 100 Index, which suggests that the stock price of Apple Inc. is likely to rise.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news suggests a continued bull run for the Nasdaq 100, driven by favorable factors such as reduced concerns over rising bond yields and positive technical signals. The analyst notes that technology stocks, including Apple Inc., are well-positioned to continue leading the market. While there are potential risks such as upcoming earnings reports and Federal Reserve policy decisions, the overall sentiment is positive for technology stocks.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article presents a largely bullish outlook for the Nasdaq 100 and, by extension, its constituent, Apple.  Analysts cite positive technical indicators, a pullback in bond yields (reducing pressure on tech stocks), and the expectation of continued strong performance from Big Tech.  While upcoming earnings reports and Fed decisions introduce uncertainty, the overall sentiment is positive.  The consensus among previous models leans towards a higher probability of a price rise for AAPL. However, I've adjusted the probabilities slightly downward to account for the inherent market volatility and the risk associated with upcoming earnings announcements.  The fact that the Nasdaq 100 is already near record highs also suggests a potential for consolidation or a minor correction, even within a bullish overall trend.",
```
